intro: Hedyotis schlechtendahliana f. dichotoma, commonly known as the dichotomous strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and opposite leaf arrangement. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
